Abstract: This autobiographical exploration delves into the life and career of Estella Atekwana, a distinguished figure in the field of biogeophysics and continental rifts. Through a narrative that intertwines personal experiences with professional achievements, the text highlights Atekwana's contributions to understanding the Earth's subsurface processes and her role in advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) within the geosciences. The account also sheds light on the challenges and strategies associated with fostering student success in STEM fields, as well as navigating the complexities of being part of a dual-career couple in academia. This autobiography not only serves as a testament to Atekwana's resilience and dedication but also offers insights into the broader implications of her work for the scientific community and society at large.
